alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 23 at 3:20PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...SNOW AND WINTRY MIXED PRECIPITATION EXPECTED ACROSS THE MIDDLE KUSKOKWIM VALLEY THROUGH MONDAY... A low pressure system moving inland near the Kuskokwim Delta will bring a mix of snow, sleet, freezing rain, and rain to parts of the Middle Kuskokwim Valley this evening through Monday. The heaviest snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches are expected from Sleetmute west through early Monday morning. Southeast winds will transport warmer air into the region by late Monday morning, changing snow over to all rain. A short period of sleet and freezing rain is possible during this transition, with a light glaze of icing possible before temperatures warm above freezing. Colder air will move back in from the west Monday afternoon, changing remaining precipitation back to all snow.
